content.question: The circuit above shows an ideal battery connected to three resistors. Which of the following correctly ranks the potential difference, <math alttext="delta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, across the different resistors?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta V sub 1 is greater than delta V sub 3, which is greater than delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 is equal to delta V sub 3, which is greater than delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 is equal to delta V sub 2, which is greater than delta V sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 1 is greater than delta V sub 2, which is equal to delta V sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub 2 is greater than delta V sub 1, which is equal to delta V sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V sub 1 is greater than delta V sub 3, which is greater than delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
